meaning: 1. To be enough to eat; all you can eat 2. To fill one's stomach
description: Often used to imply that quantity is sufficient to satisfy hunger.

examples.chinese: 一个切两份分两次吃,半个就管饱
examples.translation: Cut one into two portions to eat twice, half is enough to verify hunger.

examples.chinese: 今天是连饭都没时间吃的,一天一顿管饱
examples.translation: I didn't even have time to eat today, just one full meal a day is enough.

examples.chinese: 来我家,没什么好菜但我保证肉管饱,酒管够
examples.translation: Come to my house, there are no fancy dishes but I guarantee enough meat to fill you up and enough wine.

examples.chinese: 胃口变大了,以前一个汉堡可以吃撑 现在两个汉堡才管饱
examples.translation: My appetite has grown; I used to be stuffed with one burger, now it takes two to get full.
